resources:
UNL Bathrooms UNL Bathrooms Find Bathrooms! UNL logo Avery Hall Oldfather Hall On City Campus, Oldfather Hall is right cross the Avery Hall which is located at southeast of Memorial Stadium. Andrews Hall Request a Bathroom Contribute On City Campus, Avery Hall is southeast of Memorial Stadium and home to the Math and Computer Science departments Located near selleck quadrangle. English lectures held here, also writing center is here. This page is currently under construction Avery Hall Basement Avery Hall 1st Floor Andrews Hall 1st Floor Andrews Hall 2nd Floor Andrews Hall 3rd Floor Avery Hall 2nd Floor Avery Hall 3rd Floor Click here if you would like to contribute and add a bathroom Men\'s bathrooms will be denoted by an \"M\", followed by a number (Ex:M1). Women\'s bathrooms will be denoted by an \"W\", followed by a number (Ex:W1). Male Room 103,\nFemale Room 123. Male Room 230,\nFemale Room 217. Male Room 335,\nFemale Room 339.1. The largest bathroom in Avery, this bathroom boasts seven stalls(two handicap), three urinals, and four sinks. In between classes this bathroom becomes very busy, causing it to be quite messy at times. What do I mean by messy? Sometimes you go into a stall and it looks like teenagers were TP-ing a house that wouldn\'t give them candy on Halloween. Because of the amount of traffic, this bathroom gets 3 stars in spite of it\'s large amount of amenities. On the busiest floor of Avery sits the smallest bathroom in the building. One urinal, one stall, and two sinks. If you try to use this bathroom in between classes, prepare to wait in line. If you\'re patient enough to wait in line, you will realize the pressure on your shoulders once it\'s your turn. You can feel the eyes on the back of your head, glaring at you to hurry up and finish. Expect no privacy in here. The only plus side of this bathroom is it is relatively clean for how much traffic it receives. This is because if someone makes a mess, it\'s easy to find the culprit. There is no way you can wash your hands and exit the bathroom without someone seeing what you\'ve done. You will be caught. Avery\'s best kept secret. I was hesitant to write an honest review for this bathroom because of the increased activity that is bound to come. Two urinals, two stalls(one handicap), and three sinks are more than enough for this hidden gem. Due to the low amount of traffic, this bathroom is exceptionally clean. Come here for a relaxing experience, whether it\'s relieving yourself or simply sitting in a stall and enjoying a sandwich.
Two urinals, two stalls(one handicap), three sinks. Identical to the bathroom on the second floor but a little more traffic. Nothing special about this bathroom, but it will get the job done. The largest women bathroom in Avery, this bathroom boasts nine stalls(two handicap), four sinks, and two paper towel machine. However, this bathroom does not provide feminine hygiene products.\nThis bathroom is not very busy between classes, but sometimes the paper towels are ran out quickly. (Don\'t worry, there\'re enough roll paper towels prepared for each stalls.) This bathroom is also pretty clean during the day. Since it does not have feminine hygiene products, this bathroom gets 4 stars. The smallest women bathroom with two stalls, two sinks and one paper towel machine. The feminine hygiene product machine is out of use. This bathroom can be super busy between classes, so going downstairs\'s bathroom is a better choice.Sometimes it can be really messy and the toilet is not always in its good condition. In conclusion, 3 stars is given for this bathroom. The women bathroom on second floor has four sinks, four stalls and one of them is handicap stall. It does not have feminine hygiene products. It is mainly provided for office workers so it is not busy during the day. It is also super clean. Next to this bathroom is the elevator, so it is very convenient for the disabled people. Overall, it has 4 stars. The women bathroom on third floor has the same structure as second floor’s — four sinks, four stalls and one of them is handicap stall. It does not have feminine hygiene products. It is mainly provided for office workers so it is not busy during the day. It is also super clean. Next to this bathroom is the elevator, so it is very convenient for the disabled people. Overall, it has 4 stars.
On the busiest floor of Andrews sits the smallest bathroom in the building. One urinal, one stall, and two sinks. If you try to use this bathroom in between classes, prepare to wait in line. If you\'re patient enough to wait in line, you will realize the pressure on your shoulders once it\'s your turn. You can feel the eyes on the back of your head, glaring at you to hurry up and finish. Expect no privacy in here. The only plus side of this bathroom is it is relatively clean for how much traffic it receives. This is because if someone makes a mess, it\'s easy to find the culprit. There is no way you can wash your hands and exit the bathroom without someone seeing what you\'ve done. You will be caught. Andrews\'s best kept secret. I was hesitant to write an honest review for this bathroom because of the increased activity that is bound to come. Two urinals, two stalls(one handicap), and three sinks are more than enough for this hidden gem. Due to the low amount of traffic, this bathroom is exceptionally clean. Come here for a relaxing experience, whether it\'s relieving yourself or simply sitting in a stall and enjoying a sandwich.
Two urinals, two stalls(one handicap), three sinks. Identical to the bathroom on the second floor but a little more traffic. Nothing special about this bathroom, but it will get the job done. >>>>>>> e6cbc4c22d84cd765438336ee1f55d0431286eff
If you would like to have a bathroom added to the app, please include: \n - what building and floor the bathroom is in \n - a rating \n - a picture of the bathroom \n - a review
